snippet: The United Nations General Assembly overwhelmingly approved a pioneering treaty that links sales of conventional weapons to the human rights records of the buyers.
abstract: United Nations General Assembly votes overwhelmingly to approve pioneering treaty aimed at regulating enormous global trade in conventional weapons, for first time linking sales to human rights records of the buyers; treaty reflects growing international sentiment that multibillion-dollar weapons trade needs to be held to a moral standard.

byline.contributor: Rick Gladstone contributed reporting from New York, and Jonathan Weisman from Washington.

lead_paragraph: The United Nations General Assembly overwhelmingly approved a pioneering treaty that links sales of conventional weapons to the human rights records of the buyers.

headline.seo: Arms Trade Treaty Approved at U.N.
headline.main: U.N. Treaty Is First Aimed at Regulating Global Arms Sales
headline.print_headline: U.N. Approves First Weapons Treaty Aimed at Regulating Global Sales
